definition: to pray on behalf of sb
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Let us continue to pray for this family.
sentences.chinese: 请我们为这个家来代祷。

sentences.english: Paul had three specific requests in verses 31, 32.
sentences.chinese: 保罗在第31和32节提出三项明确的代祷要求。

sentences.english: As I spend time in intercession, I will see more conversions.
sentences.chinese: 当我花时间代祷时，会看见更多人归向主。

sentences.english: Pray for each fellowship and group, pray for their2007 new ministry and their needs.
sentences.chinese: 为各团契小组即将展开的新事工及所需要的同工代祷。

sentences.english: This is Tim's (Mu-tien) third prayer letter.
sentences.chinese: 这是慕天的第三封代祷信。

sentences.english: An earnest prayer for your country and other countries is well becoming in the mouth of every believer.
sentences.chinese: 信徒要为万国万民常常迫切代祷，本是圣经的教导。

sentences.english: Brother Chuajun's pain in his neck still needs our urgent prayers.
sentences.chinese: 朝正兄脖子的疼痛仍然需要我们大家迫切的代祷。

sentences.english: I have a very urgent and special prayer request.
sentences.chinese: 我有一个非常紧急又很特别的代祷恳求。

sentences.english: Why do the promises of God need intercession to be fulfilled?
sentences.chinese: 为什么上帝的应许需要代祷者来实现？

sentences.english: Pray for your Ministries, Please send me information.
sentences.chinese: 为贵会代祷，请寄上代祷资料。
为邱小妹妹得医治代祷。

sentences.english: Not wanting to be left behind, I went to the stage during the height of intercession .
sentences.chinese: 不想被忽列，我就在代祷最高峰的那一刻走上台去。

sentences.english: Our old sister So Wong still on the recovering please keep in prayer for her and family.
sentences.chinese: 苏黄女祝老姊妹仍在病患和恢复中，请大家为她代祷。

sentences.english: It is but one aspect of that mighty power of God which works in the heart of His believing people.
sentences.chinese: 代祷乃是神的大能，在信祂的人心中工作的一个凭藉。

sentences.english: Thanks for the prayers from brothers and sisters that we have experienced the Lord's glorious works!
sentences.chinese: 感谢弟兄姊妹的代祷，我们经历了主荣耀的作为。

definition: Abba (Aramaic word father)/by ext. God the Father in Christian gospel
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
